executable.title: Multi_Echo_ASL
executable.description: Calculates the Multi Echo ASL image reconstruction.
executable.acknowledgements: This work was funded by the State University of Campinas (Unicamp), Sao Paulo, Brazil.

directory.label: Output Folder
directory.description: Output folder where the calculated maps are saved. The user is responsible to inform where is an avaliable folder to save the files (i.e. must be a folder where the user is allowed to read and write files).

double-vector.name: echos
double-vector.label: Echo Times (TE)
double-vector.description: The echo times (TE) used in the ASL imaging protocol. Informs each floating point number separated by single space.

double-vector.name: pld
double-vector.label: Post-Labelling Delays (PLD)
double-vector.description: The post-labelling delays (PLD) used in the ASL imaging protocol. Informs each floating point number separated by single space.

double-vector.name: ld
double-vector.label: Labelling Duration (LD)
double-vector.description: The labelling duration (LD) used in the ASL imaging protocol. Informs each floating point number separated by single space.

image.name: outputVolume
image.label: Output T Blood-GM Map
image.description: Output T blood-GM map obtained from the multi echo ASL processing.

file.name: inputASL
file.label: Input ASL file
file.description: Input ASL file in .nii or nii.gz format

file.name: inputM0
file.label: Input M0
file.description: Input the M0 file to use as the reference signal for ASL computation. Provide the M0 file in .nii or nii.gz format

file.name: labelMask
file.label: Input brain mask
file.description: Input the brain mask informing the ROI where the calculations will be applied. If empty, the entire image is used for the calculations (requires a longer processing time). Any pixel value different from zero is adopted as a valid brain label. Use brain mask file in .nii or nii.gz format

double.name: t2b
double.label: T2 Blood (ms)
double.description: The T2 value for the blood. By default, the value of 165 ms is assumed.

double.name: t2gm
double.label: T2 Gray Matter (ms)
double.description: The T2 value for the blood. By default, the value of 75 ms is assumed.
